definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: Wei Zhe calm and cool due to his "Jinling curriculum vitae."
sentences.chinese: 衛哲的從容和冷靜緣於他的“金領簡歷”。

sentences.english: At the other end of the spectrum are the "gold-collar" workers.
sentences.chinese: 衣領暗碼光譜的另一端則是“金領”上班族。

sentences.english: It was then, I became an entrepreneur.
sentences.chinese: 從此，我從一個準金領階級成爲了創業者。

sentences.english: The goal of the model software college is to cultivate software Golden-Collars.
sentences.chinese: 示範性軟件學院的培養目標是培養軟件金領。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, we are turned into gold-collar workers.
sentences.chinese: 一不小心，我們成了金領。

sentences.english: Gold-collar worker in a foreign country also belongs to afford the brand.
sentences.chinese: 在國外也屬於金領才能買得起的品牌。

definition: lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections

pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Di4 er4 Wai4 guo2 yu3 Xue2 yuan4
